page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN THE AREA
page.content: There is no public bus service in this area due to its being a rural region. The population of the area in question is very scattered.An obvious disadvantage being of course that the bus would have to cover a large number of miles,often down very narrow country lanes,to collect just one or two people.Consequently a bus service in this district, is not economically viable.Furthermore, the majority of people who live in a country district, recognize the necessity of owning their own transport.Hence the bone of contention which has become a political issue, namely the escalated and escalating cost of petrol.A private bus company has a contract to transport the children to school, where they beaver away,gleefully, on the Domesday project!
